Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and U.S. Department of Justice fined Sims Metal Management $189,500 for polluting San Francisco Bay with scrap metal debris in violation of the federal Clean Water Act. Since at least the early 1990s, Sims operated a conveyor belt without adequate pollution controls to prevent materials from falling off the conveyor and into the Bay.

Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Description: Sims Recycling agreed to pay a $275,000 penalty and $125,000 costs in settlement of allegations it illegally treated, stored, transported and disposed of hazardous waste containing mercury, copper, lead, nickel, and zinc, among other compounds, and failed to operate its facility in a manner to minimize the release of hazardous waste.
Agency: California Department of Toxic Substances Control
